author: reuters
title: Casais católicos do mesmo sexo não devem receber bênçãos em grande parte da África
text: Casais católicos do mesmo sexo não devem receber bênçãos em grande parte da África O casal católico nigeriano Jane e Lucy tem pouca esperança de que sua paróquia local abençoe a união em breve, pois os padres conservadores de toda a África decidiram ignorar uma decisão histórica do Vaticano que permite bênçãos a casais do mesmo sexo. Os católicos conservadores têm condenado a declaração do Vaticano de duas semanas atrás, que foi aprovada pelo papa Francisco, que permitirá bênçãos para casais do mesmo sexo, desde que não façam parte dos rituais ou liturgias regulares da Igreja. O papa tem rebatido as críticas e o que ele chamou de posições ideológicas inflexíveis que impedem a Igreja de avançar. Mas em muitos países africanos, como o mais populoso do continente, a Nigéria, até mesmo ter um relacionamento entre pessoas do mesmo sexo é proibido e muitas vezes punido com longas penas de prisão. Não é uma surpresa que Jane, de 39 anos, que vive com sua parceira há seis anos, não ache que a declaração do Vaticano vá mudar muita coisa. "Talvez nos próximos 20 anos (ou) nos próximos 30 anos, mas agora será difícil para eles (bispos) simplesmente aceitarem isso", disse Jane à Reuters no Estado de Benue. Bispos católicos de Angola, Quênia, Nigéria, Malaui, São Tomé e Príncipe, Uganda e Zimbábue estão entre os clérigos que disseram que não abençoarão casais do mesmo sexo, mas argumentaram que o decreto do papa pode ser interpretado como opcional. O padre Patrick Alumunku, da paróquia de Mbora da Igreja Católica St Louis, na capital Abuja, disse que a declaração do Vaticano foi perturbadora para muitos seguidores, mas deve ser vista como um movimento em direção à inclusão de todos os filhos de Deus. Ele negou que esse fosse um passo incremental para eventualmente aceitar uniões entre pessoas do mesmo sexo na Igreja. "Há leis que foram feitas por Deus e pela igreja em 2000 anos que não podem mudar", disse Alumunku. Para a ativista e avicultora Jane, o fato de a questão estar sendo discutida abertamente é motivo suficiente para considerar a possibilidade de abordar seu padre para obter uma bênção, se sua parceira concordar. "Acho que ele (o papa Francisco) tentou entender os sentimentos das pessoas que tendem a nascer diferentes ou das pessoas que basicamente estão se tornando os párias desta sociedade", disse ela.

author: Barishal Correspondent
title: Man dies after bus rolls over and falls into pond in Barishal
text:
A man has died and eight others have been injured after a bus overturned and plunged into a roadside pond in Barishal’s Gournadi Upazila.
The incident occurred in the Bezhar Station area along the Barishal-Dhaka highway around 10:30pm on Thursday, said Gournadi Highway Police Station chief Golam Rasul Molla.
The dead passenger has been identified as Selim Reza, 42, a native of Jashore’s Manirampur Upazila. He was travelling to Barishal to visit his in-laws.
Md Mejbah, another bus passenger who suffered minor injuries, said the Hanif Paribahan bus left Dhaka’s Syedabad with 30-35 passengers around 6pm. It was en route to Barishal’s Nathullahbad bus terminal.
After overtaking a couple of vehicles, the speeding bus was on a collision course with an oncoming truck when the driver veered it off the road, according to Yusuf, a witness who took part in the rescue effort after the incident.
“Unable to get back on the road, the vehicle overturned and struck a tree. The roof of the bus broke off and it fell into a roadside pond.”
Delwar, the driver of the bus, had been driving recklessly for a long time despite being warned multiple times, overtaking vehicles one after one, bus supervisor Bellal said.
Bellal fell into the pond during the incident. Along with the driver, he was rushed to Sher-e Bangla Medical College Hospital in Barishal.
Reza died on the spot. The injured were sent to Gournadi Upazila Health Complex and Sher-e Bangla Medical College Hospital, Fire Service Station Officer Bipul Hossain said.
Police have recovered the bus.

author: Redacción Clarín
title: Karina Jelinek: "Leonardo Fariña me debe más de 100.000 dólares"
text: Karina Jelinek dio un móvil desde Mar del Plata para A la tarde (América, a las 15.30), el ciclo que conduce Karina Mazzocco, y en ese marco, hizo revelaciones sobre lo que fue su matrimonio y posterior divorcio con el financista [Leonardo Fariña](https://www.clarin.com/tema/JfR3qsWhte.html). En el curso de la entrevista donde habló también de asuntos más frívolos, de pronto, le recordaron a [Karina Jelinek](https://www.clarin.com/tema/XzqwkZ1hXx.html) su divorcio de Leonardo Fariña, quien por esa época era investigado en la causa conocida como la Ruta del Dinero K. Karina y Fariña se habían casado en abril de 2011, al cabo de tan sólo tres meses de noviazgo, e hicieron una fiesta de boda a todo trapo en el lujoso Tattersall de Palermo. En 2014, ella decidió iniciar los trámites de divorcio del financista cuando él quedó vinculado a Lázaro Báez e involucrado en temas de corrupción. En A la tarde, le recordaron a Karina aquel episodio de su vida: "En aquel momento, vos dijiste 'No quiero absolutamente nada, hago borrón y cuenta nueva. Lo único que quiero es el divorcio". Ante ese planteo, Jelinek respondió: "Hace mucho que me separé, pero el divorcio tardó un montón en salir". Y recordó: "Cuando yo lo dejé (a Fariña), él se enojó conmigo. Me echó el piso de (avenida Del) Libertador, que él me lo había regalado cuando nos casamos, pero nunca se concretó...". Karina Jelinek: "A Fariña lo perdoné y que Dios haga Justicia" A continuación, Karina explicó por qué nunca se llegó a concretar el regalo del departamento que Fariña le había prometido. "El departamento era de (Cecilia) Bolocco y de (Carlos Saúl) Menem y yo tenía que firmar un papel, pero siempre me decía que Bolocco no había llegado". "Gracias a Dios, yo nunca firmé ese papel -razonó Karina a la vista de cómo resultaron los hechos-. ¡Menos mal, Dios me cuidó, porque yo me di cuenta de que no quería nada de ese chico (Fariña)". Decidida a no quedar atada a un pasado que la hizo infeliz, Karina expresó: "¨Pero ya está, ya fue. A Fariña ya lo perdoné. No voy a cargar con esa mochila y enfermarme por eso. Yo ya lo perdoné y lo dejo en las manos de Dios, que Dios haga Justicia". "Yo prefiero empezar de nuevo -siguió- y no tener nada de lo que no corresponde. Yo dejé ese departamento (de la avenida Del Libertador) y lo único que me quedé fueron dos teles y algunos muebles. Y encima, él me debe plata, porque yo le presté plata una vez". Los integrantes de A la tarde, que desconocían que Leo Fariña le debiera dinero a su ex mujer Karina Jelinek, le pidieron que se explayara sobre el tema. Karina Jelinek reveló cómo fue que Fariña terminó debiéndole más de cien mil dólares Ella detalló: "Un día, (Fariña) me dijo: 'Por favor, prestame, prestame. Yo soy tu marido, ¿no confiás en mí? Yo te compré esta cartera, yo te compré estos zapatos...". "¿Cuánta plata le prestate, Karina?", le preguntó, sin vueltas, Mazzocco. "Arriba de cien...", dijo, resignada,Jelinek. "¡¿Cien mil dólares?!", quiso corroborar la conductora. "Un poco más, no recuerdo la cifra exacta", contestó la ex esposa de Fariña. "Es que en tu marido confiás en ese momento... ¿Cómo no le iba a prestar? Las cosas se comparten: un día paga uno, otro día paga el otro... Al menos yo creo que es así. A mí no me gusta ser una mantenida, yo trabajo desde chica", añadió. Newsletter Clarín Tags relacionados

author: NewIndianXpress
title: No coercive action against RSS leader for allegedly insulting Muslim women: Karnataka HC
text:
No coercive action against RSS leader for allegedly insulting Muslim women: Karnataka HC
Meanwhile, the III Additional District and Sessions Judge in Mandya granted bail to Bhat in the Srirangapatna case following his submission about his health condition.
Published: 29th December 2023 02:15 PM | Last Updated: 29th December 2023 02:15 PM | A+A A-
BENGALURU: The High Court of Karnataka has directed the state not to take coercive action against RSS leader Kalladka Prabhakar Bhat for his speech on December 24 in Srirangapatna, allegedly insulting Muslim women.
The vacation bench of Justice Rajesh Rai, who heard the petition by Bhat, on Thursday issued notices to the state and the complainant in the case and directed the State Public Prosecutor not to take coercive action till the next date of hearing.
The arrest of Bhat in the case, therefore, is stalled.
Senior advocate Arun Shyam, who appeared for Bhat, argued that the case was politically motivated and the RSS leader had only stated facts which were protected under the right to speech.
Najma Nazeer, a social worker, had lodged the complaint and the police in Srirangapatna had booked Bhat under Sections 354 (Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty), 294 (dealing with uttering obscene words in a public place), 509 ( Word, gesture or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman), 153A (promoting enmity between different groups on ground of religion), 295 (Injuring or defiling place of worship with intent to insult the religion of any class), 295A (Deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs), 298 (deliberate hurting of religious feelings) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).
Meanwhile, the III Additional District and Sessions Judge in Mandya granted bail to Bhat in the Srirangapatna case following his submission about his health condition.
Bhat underwent cardiovascular surgery on April 5, 2022.
"Hence there is substance in the contention of the petitioner that he is suffering from severe cardiac health issues," the Sessions Court noted, and citing earlier Supreme Court judgements, granted Bhat anticipatory bail.
He was directed to submit a personal bond for Rs 2 lakh and a surety for a like sum.
The Sessions Court, however, clarified that the "investigator is at liberty to interrogate him as provided under relevant provisions of the CrPC."

author: 张胶
title: 特朗普：美国比俄罗斯更擅长黑入计算机系统
text:
当地时间8月13日，美国总统特朗普在回答记者有关“俄罗斯黑客‘黑入’美国联邦法院计算机系统”的提问时表示，他对俄罗斯可能黑入系统并不意外，“我们也很更擅长，甚至比他们更擅长”。特朗普还说，他可能在阿拉斯加与普京会面时向普京提起此事。
【责任编辑：张胶 编辑：朱宏利】 分享： 推荐
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: Amy Locurto
title: Heart Fruit Pizza
text:
Have a Pizza My Heart with an easy fruit pizza recipe! How to make a Nutella and fresh strawberry heart shaped dessert pizza for Valentine’s Day. It’s sweet and simple made with refrigerated pizza dough.
How to Make a Heart Fruit Pizza
Need a quick and easy dessert for
Valentine’s Day? Forget the store bough chocolates and say “I love you” with this cute heart shaped fruit pizza with Nutella and strawberry hearts.
It’s easy enough that even your kids will want to help you make it.
You’ve Got a Pizza My Heart!
This easy fruit pizza is a fun surprise for a family breakfast or Valentine’s Day party.
Host a Galentine’s Day party and make this cute heart shaped dessert pizza for your girlfriends. They’ll love it!
How Do You Make a Heart Dessert Pizza?
Making a heart shaped pizza was much easier than I thought it would be.
First of all you can either make your own pizza dough, or use
refrigerated pizza dough like I did. I used thin pizza dough that when you roll out is square.
Step 1
Roll the pizza dough out on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper. Turn the baking sheet horizontally.
Step 2
With a sharp knife, gently draw a heart shape in the middle of the dough. Don’t cut all the way through the dough, this is just to make a visible mark.
Step 3
Cut an inch outside of the line you drew with the knife. This area will be the dough crust. Remove the access dough to save for later.
Step 4
Shape the pizza to be a heart. Use the extra dough for added areas of crust where you need it.
For fun, shape some small hearts out of the extra dough. These will be cute later in your presentation.
You might also love these recipes:
Out of this world Nutella French Toast Valentine Minnie Mouse Cookie Pops Easy Strawberry Pie Strawberry Chocolate Kiss Cookies
How Long Do You Bake Fruit Pizza Crust?
Now that you’ve got your heart shaped pizza dough ready to go, it’s time to bake the crust!
If using refrigerated pizza dough, you’ll want to bake the pizza dough at 400 degrees for 8 minutes.
Strawberry and Nutella Dessert Pizza
While the pizza dough is cooking, cut 6-8 fresh strawberries in half and shape like hearts.
This is very simple as the strawberries already look very similar to hearts. You just need to round the top of the strawberry to look like a heart shape.
After the dough has baked in the oven for 8 minutes, remove the dough from the oven.
Melt a tablespoon of butter and add a tablespoon of sugar to the butter. Stir well until the sugar dissolves.
Brush the butter mixture all over the pizza dough, then place it back into the oven to bake for another 3-5 minutes until the dough is golden brown and baking through.
Decorating Your Heart Shaped Fruit Pizza
After removing from the oven, let the pizza dough cool.
Sprinkle the edge of the heart with powdered sugar then move your heart pizza dough over to a serving board.
Spread a generous amount of Nutella over the dough then place your heart shaped strawberries on top.
Place the smaller pizza hearts around the large fruit pizza for an adorable Valentine’s Day treat!
Originally published February 12, 2020 – Updated January 20223
Heart Fruit Pizza
Equipment
Ingredients
- 1 can
refrigerated pizza dough
- 1 tablespoon butter melted
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- ½ cup
Nutella
- 1 cup strawberries
- 1 tablespoon powdered sugar
Instructions
- Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
- Roll the pizza dough out on a baking sheet covered with parchment paper. Turn the baking sheet horizontally.
- With a sharp knife, gently draw a heart shape in the middle of the dough. Don’t cut all the way through the dough, this is just to make a visible mark.
- Cut an inch outside of the line you drew with the knife. This area will be the dough crust. Remove the access dough to save for later.
- Shape the pizza to be a heart. Use the extra dough for added areas of crust where you need it.
- Bake the pizza dough for 8 minutes.
- While the pizza dough is cooking, cut 6-8 fresh strawberries in half and shape like hearts.
- After the dough has baked for 8 minutes, remove from the oven.
- In a small bowl, melt butter and add sugar to the butter. Stir well until the sugar dissolves. Brush the butter mixture all over the pizza dough.
- Place the dough back into the oven to bake for another 3-5 minutes until the pizza is golden brown and baking through.
- After removing from the oven, let your heart shaped pizza cool cool.
- Sprinkle the edge of the heart with powdered sugar then move your heart pizza to a serving board.
- Spread a generous amount of Nutella over the dough then place your heart shaped strawberries on top.
- Place the smaller pizza hearts around the large fruit pizza for an adorable Valentine’s Day treat!
- Slice when ready to serve.
@LivingLocurtoor tag #LivingLocurtoon Instagram. We’d love to see! [CLICK HERE -> To Leave a Comment](#commentform)

author: TNN
title: Togadia: Togadia invited to consecration of Ram temple in Ayodhya | Ahmedabad News - Times of India
text: Ahmedabad: Office-bearers of the state Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) met Antarrashtriya Hindu Parishad (AHP) president Pravin Togadia in Ahmedabad and handed him an invitation on behalf of the Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra to attend consecration of the Ram temple in Ayodhya on January 22. Accepting the invitation, Togadia said, “Several generations over the past 450 years have been striving for this moment, which is a landmark for Hindus all over the country and world. I thank the Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra for the invitation.”TNNWe also published the following articles recentlyWho's in, who's out: Political tensions rise as some turn down Ram Temple consecration invitationControversy arises over invitations for the upcoming consecration ceremony of the Ram Temple in Ayodhya. CPI (M) declines the invitation, calling it an attempt to politicise a religious event. Samajwadi Party leader expresses willingness to attend if invited. Shiv Sena takes a dig at BJP over guest list. BJP defends the invitations, stating that they have been sent to all. Congress president and Sonia Gandhi are invited by the Ram Mandir Trust.106309601Ram Mandir consecration will be celebrated: VHP VP Jagadeesh HebbarVishwa Hindu Parishad vice-president Jagadeesh Hebbar announced preparations for the Prana Prathistapan Mahotsav, the consecration ceremony of Sri Ram Mandir in Ayodhya on January 22. The event will be celebrated in a grand manner, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and other leaders participating. Right wing organizations have called for Hindus to celebrate the day like a festival. Big LED screens will be set up in multiple locations in the city to watch the ceremony, and a door-to-door campaign will be conducted to distribute Mantrakshate, a portrait of Sri Ram and Sri Ram Mandir.106391838Have not been invited to Ram temple inauguration: Sharad PawarNCP president Sharad Pawar expressed his discontent for not being invited to the inauguration of the Ram temple in Ayodhya. Pawar questioned the BJP's motives, whether they were using the issue for political or commercial gain. The temple is set to be inaugurated on January 22, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, and thousands of attendees. In response to being asked if he was invited, Pawar confirmed he was not. Additionally, PM Modi will hold a roadshow and address a public meeting after inaugurating an airport in Ayodhya on December 30.106329298

author: @TIMESNOW
title: US-Israel Squabble Over Peace-Proposal; Israel Or Hezbollah: Who Will Yield First? | Global-Mirror | Times Now
text: Trending: US-Israel Squabble Over Peace-Proposal; Israel Or Hezbollah: Who Will Yield First? | Global-Mirror In this episode of Global Mirror, anchor Shreya Upadhyaya discusses how Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office dismissed international calls for a cease-fire with Hezbollah on Thursday, following a joint appeal from US President Joe Biden and French President Emmanuel Macron for a temporary truce. On Wednesday, both leaders urged the parties involved to support the widely backed proposal, but by Thursday, no indication of support had emerged, and the exchange of deadly fire persisted.A panel of experts has joined Shreya Upadhyaya to discuss this in detail. Journalist Ray Locker says ‘Israel has the right to defend itself, it has the money to buys arms, their military defense system is built on American defense system...” Watch the full discussion to know more and follow Mirror Now for the latest updates..#israel #hezbollah #israelhezbollah #ceasefire #lebanon #us #netanyahu #uspresident #englishnews #latestnews #worldnews #globalmirror #shreyaupadhyaya #mirrornow
